# IEEE VR 2026: Call for Papers

IEEE VR 2026 seeks original, high-quality papers in all areas related to virtual reality (VR), including augmented reality (AR), mixed reality (MR), and 3D user interfaces (3DUIs).

There is a **SINGLE submission deadline** for a unified review process for both IEEE TVCG and conference-only papers. The possible outcomes are:

*   **Accept as IEEE TVCG paper**, with presentation at IEEE VR 2026
*   **Accept as IEEE VR 2026 conference paper**, with presentation at IEEE VR 2026
*   **Accept as IEEE VR 2026 poster**
*   **Reject**

*Note: Papers will not be automatically accepted as IEEE VR Posters. Authors of rejected papers will have to submit directly to the poster track.*

Inquiries can be directed to: [program2026@ieeevr.org](mailto:program2026@ieeevr.org)

## Important Dates

Each deadline is **23:59:59 AoE (Anywhere on Earth)**.

*   **Abstracts due (REQUIRED):** September 05, 2025
*   **Submissions due:** September 12, 2025
*   **Initial notifications:** December 12, 2025
*   **Revised submissions due:** January 16, 2026
*   **Final notifications:** January 23, 2026
*   **Camera-ready materials due:** January 30, 2026

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Submission Platform:** Precision Conference Solutions ([https://new.precisionconference.com/vr26a](https://new.precisionconference.com/vr26a))
*   **Review Process:** IEEE VR 2026 uses a **DOUBLE-BLIND review process**. Failure to anonymize submissions will result in **DESK REJECTION**.
*   **Contribution Categories:** Each research paper should cover one or more of the following:
    *   **Methodological papers:** Describe advances in theories and methods of AR/VR/MR and 3DUI.
    *   **Technical papers:** Describe advancements in algorithms or devices critical to AR/VR/MR and 3DUI development.
    *   **Application papers:** Provide insights by explaining how existing ideas were applied to solve a problem in a novel way, including an evaluation.
    *   **System papers:** Indicate how techniques and technologies were integrated to produce an effective system, conveying lessons learned.
*   **Evaluation:** Each paper should include an evaluation of its contributions (e.g., user studies, benchmarking).
*   **Format:** Papers must be strictly formatted according to IEEE VGTC conference submission guidelines and submitted electronically as PDF documents. Use the IEEE Computer Society VGTC conference format.
    *   **MS Word Template:** Ensure the final submission matches the formatting guidelines or it may be desk rejected. Check sample PDF documents for correct formatting.
*   **Page Limit:** **4-9 pages** with an additional **2 pages for references**. Appendices are included in the page count.
*   **Supplementary Materials:** Provide in a separate file. Videos are encouraged to aid reviewing.

## Topics

IEEE VR 2026 seeks contributions in VR/AR/MR and 3DUI including, but not limited to, the following topics:

*   360° video
*   3D and volumetric display and projection technology
*   3D authoring
*   3D user interfaces
*   Accessibility of immersive interfaces
*   Audio interfaces and rendering
*   Collaborative interactions
*   Computer graphics techniques
*   Crowd simulation
*   Cybersickness
*   Diversity and gender issues
*   Embodied agents, virtual humans and (self-)avatars
*   Ethical issues
*   Evaluation methods
*   Haptic interfaces and rendering
*   Human factors and ergonomics
*   Immersive analytics and visualization
*   Immersive applications and games
*   Input devices
*   Locomotion and navigation
*   Mediated and diminished reality
*   Mobile, desktop or hybrid 3DUIs
*   Modeling and simulation
*   Multi-user and distributed systems
*   Multimodal capturing and reconstruction
*   Multimodal/cross-modal interaction and perception
*   Multisensory interfaces and rendering
*   Perception and cognition
*   Presence, body ownership, and agency
*   Redirection
*   Software architectures, toolkits, and engineering
*   Teleoperation and telepresence
*   Therapy and rehabilitation
*   Touch, tangible and gesture interfaces
*   Tracking
*   User experience and usability
*   XR technology infrastructure

## Review Process

*   **Review Cycle I (Submission to Initial notification):** Submissions are assigned to two IPC members for initial review. Early rejection is possible for guideline violations or low scores. This stage is double blind. Other submissions will receive at least three reviews.
*   **Review Cycle II (Initial notification to Final decision):** Revisions of conditionally accepted papers are reviewed by their coordinator for a final recommendation.

## Additional Guidelines

*   **Abstract Submission:** A paper abstract must be uploaded **seven days prior** to the paper submission deadline.
*   **Ethics and Responsibility:** Research with human participants must follow institutional ethical guidelines and obtain relevant ethics committee approval. Approval details must be reported, and proof must be available upon request. Incorrect reporting will result in desk rejection.
*   **Participant Diversity:** Research submissions, especially those claiming general benefit, should strive for participant diversity (e.g., gender, age). Participant demographics must be reported. Reviewers will consider participant diversity.
*   **Review Duties for Authors:** For each submitted paper, one author must register to review up to three papers through PCS.
*   **Presentation at Conference:** All accepted submissions must be presented orally, preferably in-person. Online presentations are accommodated only in exceptional cases.
*   **Submission Language:** All paper submissions must be in **English**.
*   **Previous Publication and Plagiarism:** Submitted manuscripts must be original and not under consideration elsewhere. Plagiarism will be checked via IEEE Crosscheck and lead to rejection.
*   **AI-generated Text:** The use of AI-generated content must be disclosed in the acknowledgments section, identifying the AI system and specific sections used.
*   **Submission Anonymity:** IEEE VR uses a **DOUBLE-BLIND review process**. Submissions must not contain author-identifying information. Previous work must be cited in the third person. Failure to adhere will result in desk rejection.
*   **Pre-dissemination:** Uploading manuscripts to online repositories (e.g., arXiv) before the review process ends is permitted but may compromise anonymity.
*   **Videos:** Videos submitted as supplementary material must be free of identifying information and will be considered for the video proceedings. Revised versions will be requested upon acceptance.

# Call for Papers - CoDIT 2025

The 11th International Conference on Control, Decision and Information Technologies (CoDIT 2025) will be held in a **hybrid format**, allowing both virtual and in-person participation, from **July 15-18, 2025**, at **Split, Croatia**.

## Welcome

CoDIT 2025 serves as a forum for technical exchange among scientists interested in Control, Automation, Robotics, Optimization, Decision, Cybernetics, Computer Science, and Information Technologies. It offers an exceptional platform for both academic and industrial communities to tackle new challenges, share solutions, and explore future research directions.

## Call for Contributed Papers

All papers must be written in English and should describe original work.

All registered and presented papers (Regular and Short-WiP) will be submitted for inclusion into **IEEE Xplore** as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.

### Regular Papers

*   The length of the paper is limited to a maximum of **6 pages** (in the standard IEEE conference double-column format).
*   Registered and presented regular papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE Xplore as well as other Abstracting and Indexing (A&I) databases.
*   Papers will be refereed through a **blind process** for technical merit and content.
*   To be eligible for publication in the Conference proceedings, an accepted paper must be presented at the Conference by one of the authors.
*   You can send your work as a regular paper or send it to one of the accepted special sessions.
*   Papers should be submitted before **April 30, 2025**.

### Short Papers (Work-in-Progress / WiP)

*   The length of WiP paper is limited to a maximum of **4 pages**.
*   At most **8 references** can be included.
*   WiP (short papers) contributors are expected to give a **short presentation** of their work (10 mn).

## Templates for Authors

The submitted papers should follow the usual IEEE paper format for conferences (two-columns, 10 point, Times New Roman).

Templates are available for:

*   [LaTeX](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/creating-a-latex-document) (Example, actual link would be provided by conference)
*   [MS Word](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/creating-a-latex-document) (Example, actual link would be provided by conference)

## Call for Special Sessions

*   The goal of special sessions (5-6 papers) and special tracks (at least two sessions) is to provide focused discussions on new topics or innovative applications.
*   Each prospective session/track organizer must submit a proposal, including the title of the session, a short description, and the organizer's name.
*   Proposals should be submitted before **January 17, 2025**.
*   To submit your proposal, please fill in the form inside the following MS Word file, convert it as PDF, and upload the generated PDF to the PaperCept Conference Management System at: [https://controls.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl](https://controls.papercept.net/conferences/scripts/start.pl) (click on the CoDIT 2024 link “Submit a special session to CoDIT 2025” and follow the steps).

## Key Dates

*   **Submission site opening:** November 07, 2024
*   **Special session Proposal:** January 17, 2025
*   **Papers submission deadline:** April 30, 2025
*   **Acceptance notification:** April 27, 2025 (for papers submitted by April 7) / May 10, 2025 (for papers submitted after April 7).
*   **Final version due:** May 27, 2025
*   **Registration deadline:** May 27, 2025

## Publications & Special Issues

Along with the publication of the proceedings in IEEE Xplore, the best-presented papers at CoDIT 2025 will have the opportunity to be extended and published in prestigious special issues:

*   International Journal of Dynamics and Control (Impact Factor: 2.2)
*   Transactions of the Institute of Measurement and Control (Impact Factor: 1.7)
*   Computational Optimization and Applications (Impact Factor: 1.6)

## Registration

Registration for CoDIT 2025 should be made online by CREDIT CARD at: [Registration Link](https://controls-registration.paperhost.net/codit25/)

# Call for Papers: COLING 2025

The 31st International Conference on Computational Linguistics (COLING 2025) invites submissions of long and short papers featuring substantial, original, and unpublished research in all aspects of Computational Linguistics and Natural Language Processing.

**Conference Dates:** January 19 – 24, 2025 (Main Conference, In-Person Only) and January 27 – 28, 2025 (Virtual Presentation Sessions).

**Location:** Abu Dhabi, UAE.

## Topics of Interest

Relevant topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Dialogue and Interactive Systems
*   Discourse and Pragmatics
*   Document Classification and Topic Modeling
*   Ethics, Bias, and Fairness
*   Information Extraction
*   Information Retrieval and Text Mining
*   Interpretability and Analysis of Models for NLP
*   Language Modeling
*   Language Resources and Evaluation
*   Linguistic Insights Derived using Computational Techniques
*   Linguistic Theories, Cognitive Modeling and Psycholinguistics
*   Low-Resource and Efficient Methods for NLP
*   Machine Learning for Computational Linguistics and NLP
*   Machine Translation and Translation Aids
*   Multilingualism and Language Diversity
*   Multimodal and Grounded Language Acquisition
*   NLP and LLM Applications (such as Education, Healthcare, Finance, Legal NLP, Computational Social Science, etc.)
*   Natural Language Generation
*   Offensive Speech Detection and Analysis
*   Phonology, Morphology and Word Segmentation
*   Question Answering
*   Lexical Semantics
*   Sentence-level Semantics (Textual Inference, Paraphrasing, etc)
*   Sentiment Analysis, Stylistic Analysis, Opinion and Argument Mining
*   Speech Recognition and Synthesis, and Spoken Language Understanding
*   Summarization and Simplification
*   Syntactic analysis (Tagging, Chunking, Parsing)
*   Vision and Robotics

Papers targeting any of these topics from the perspective of the Sustainability Goals of the UN are especially welcome.

## Submission Details

COLING 2025 invites the submission of:

*   **Long papers:** up to **eight pages** for the main body.
*   **Short papers:** up to **four pages** for the main body.

These page limits apply only to the main body of the paper. Papers must include a mandatory section discussing the limitations of the work and, optionally, a section discussing ethical considerations. Papers can include unlimited pages of references and an unlimited appendix.

Authors must follow the [general instructions for COLING 2025 proceedings](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.pdf), which are an adaptation of the general instructions for *ACL proceedings.

**Style Files:**

*   [LaTeX](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.zip)
*   [Word](https://coling2025.org/downloads/coling-2025.docx)
*   [Overleaf](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/instructions-for-coling-2025-proceedings/hfhcytgpqmzf)

Papers deviating from the provided style files will be rejected without review.

COLING 2025 adopts the [ACL Ethics Policy](https://www.aclweb.org/portal/about/ethics).

## Submission Routes

1.  **Direct Submission:**
    *   Submit through Softconf/START using the link: [https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/](https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/)
    *   Each paper will receive a minimum of three reviews.
    *   Authors will have the opportunity to provide a short rebuttal.
    *   The review process will be **double-blind**.

2.  **ACL Rolling Review (ARR) Papers:**
    *   Papers reviewed through the ARR system can be committed to COLING 2025.
    *   These papers will not be re-reviewed. Decisions will be based on ARR reviews and meta-reviews.
    *   Commit ARR papers using [Softconf/START](https://softconf.com/coling2025/papers/).

For additional information, please see the [FAQ for submissions](https://coling2025.org/faqs/submission/).

## Optional Supplementary Materials: Appendices, Software and Data

Each submission can be accompanied by a single .tgz or .zip archive containing supplementary materials (e.g., program code, datasets). COLING 2025 encourages the submission of such materials to improve reproducibility. For the main track, supplementary materials must be fully anonymized.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are 11:59 PM UTC-12:00 (“anywhere on Earth”).

*   **Direct Submission Deadline:** September 16, 2024
*   **ARR Commitment Deadline:** October 20, 2024
*   **Author Rebuttal Phase (Direct Submissions):** October 30 - November 1, 2024
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** November 29, 2024
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** December 15, 2024
*   **Arabic NLP Winter School:** January 18 - 19, 2025
*   **Workshops and Tutorials:** January 19 - 20, 2025
*   **Main Conference (In-Person):** January 21 - 24, 2025
*   **Main Conference (Virtual):** January 27 - 28, 2025

## Anonymity Policy

COLING 2025 follows the ACL Anonymity Policy. Submissions must be fully anonymized. Authors are cautioned against extensive advertising.

## Multiple Submission Policy

Papers submitted to COLING 2025 cannot be under review for other conferences or journals simultaneously. Committing a paper through ARR is treated as being under review. Papers committed to COLING 2025 via ARR cannot be submitted directly. Submissions that significantly overlap in content or results with published work will be desk-rejected.

## Contact Information

For questions about submissions, please contact: [coling2025-programchairs@googlegroups.com](mailto:coling2025-programchairs@googlegroups.com)
